title: Somalis Fled Civil War and Built a Community. Now They Are a Target.
summary: A fraud scandal has made the Somali community in Minnesota a focus of the Trump administration’s crackdown on immigrants.

title: Who Was Renee Good, the Woman Killed by an ICE Agent in Minneapolis?
summary: Ms. Good, 37, was a poet and a mother who grew up in Colorado. Her wife said the couple had “stopped to support our neighbors” when Ms. Good was shot.

title: As Death Toll Surges in Iran, Leaders Take Tough Line Against Protesters
summary: President Masoud Pezeshkian expressed sympathy for protesters’ economic pain, but said the state must respond to “rioters.” Rights groups reported a big spike in the death toll.

title: Trump Is Briefed on Options for Striking Iran as Protests Continue
summary: The president has said he will be “hitting them very hard” if Iranian leaders kill protesters amid widespread demonstrations calling for wholesale changes in the country.

title: Trump’s ‘Superstar’ Appellate Judges Have Voted 133 to 12 in His Favor
summary: President Trump promised to fill the appeals courts with “my judges.” They have formed a nearly united phalanx to defend his agenda from legal challenges.

title: Trump Shakes up Latin American Politics
summary: The U.S. capture of Nicolás Maduro has divided the region. But every nation wants to avoid being next.

title: Smithsonian Removes Label Noting Trump Impeachments
summary: When the National Portrait Gallery replaced a portrait of President Trump this week, it took down a biography of his first term.

title: Bob Weir Was the Dead’s Invisible Thread
summary: The songwriter, guitarist and singer, who died at 78, animated the Grateful Dead from within.

title: Bob Weir, Guitarist and Founding Member of The Grateful Dead, Dies at 78
summary: His songwriting and rhythm guitar playing helped shape the San Francisco band’s sound as it became an American institution.

title: Bob Weir: 10 Essential Songs
summary: The guitarist, singer and songwriter, who died at 78, cut his own path among his elders in the Grateful Dead, and beyond.

title: How Wagner Moura Stayed True to Himself and Earned a Golden Globe Nomination
summary: The Brazilian star of “The Secret Agent” is a major Oscar contender, though some at home turned against him for criticizing the right-wing government.

title: Golden Globe 2026 Nominees: Full List Including ‘One Battle After Another’
summary: The movies and TV series competing for the 83rd Golden Globes. The ceremony will air on Jan. 11.

title: How to Watch the Golden Globes 2026: Date, Time and Streaming
summary: Nikki Glaser is back as host, there’s a new podcast category and “One Battle After Another” looks to have a big night.

title: Why on Earth Have I Seen the Same Broadway Show 13 Times? An Investigation.
summary: As a journalist, I thought I’d never join the ranks of obsessive superfans — until I suddenly became one.

title: Venezuela, Renee Good and Trump’s ‘Assault on Hope’
summary: The Opinion columnist M. Gessen examines how the president governs through spectacle, and the message his displays of force are meant to send.

title: An Education Success Story
summary: We bring you some good news about schools in a place you might not expect.

title: Once Again, Oldest Mississippi Synagogue Is Attacked With Fire
summary: A suspect is in custody and has been charged with arson for setting the Saturday morning fire. It’s not the first time the Beth Israel house of worship has been attacked.

title: Thiel Gives $3 Million to Group Seeking to Block California Wealth Tax
summary: More large donations from wealthy Silicon Valley figures are expected as they try to marshal opposition to a proposed ballot measure that would impose a new tax on billionaires.

title: Where Does Candidate Mamdani End and Mayor Mamdani Begin?
summary: In his first week as mayor of New York City, Zohran Mamdani tried to bridge the political theater of his campaign with the much harder work of governing.

title: New York Seeks Ban on A.I.-Generated Images of Candidates
summary: Last year, the Cuomo campaign released a video created by artificial intelligence that depicted Zohran Mamdani eating rice with his hands. Gov. Kathy Hochul wants to ban such tactics.
